author: al.kc
title: Realworld business process use case
description: Businesses want to remove intermediaries between themselves and consumers but don’t have scalable automated solutions.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal undertakes the feasibility study for using the Cardano blockchain to solve the real-world business problem by removing the intermediaries from the Supply Chain to avoid the additional costs to the customers, thus the proposal is aligned with the challenge as it is solving the B2C business problem.

The problem of middlemen or intermediaries has been a problem for the additional costs borne by the final consumers. This is an innovative way of looking to solve this problem with the help of blockchain technology.

As this proposal relates to supply chain management, the other proposers working on the same problems can collaborate or contribute to this feasibility study.

The proposal is going to provide a whitepaper on the completion of this study. I think this study will help many other projects who are willing to use the Cardano blockchain to solve business problems specifically supply chain-related issues. But I suggest the proposer broaden the proposal’s work to include more than the removal of intermediaries.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is qualified in business process mapping and project management. The developers' details for consulting in white paper preparation are not provided in the proposal. There is no external link such as LinkedIn to recheck the team credentials.

The roadmap and the timeframes have been extensively broken down into days. This is very good and will help with following up on the progress of the proposal. 

The budget has been broken down onto a team process basis. The budget appears to be quite high in contrast to the task to be completed which is the removal of the intermediaries.

This proposal will not require additional funding as it will be accomplished on white paper writing. The interested individuals or concerns can utilize this white paper to improve the supply chain management and remove the intermediaries.
Given the above facts, the proposal is likely to be completed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal progress is auditable by tracking the status of the various tasks, which are already divided and allotted the days to complete those tasks. The proposal project manager can also prepare minutes of meeting kind of report after every discussion for proposal tracking.

The divided tasks can also be considered as the milestones of the proposal. But the ultimate success of the proposal can be seen only with the number of individuals or entities utilizing the white paper prepared under this proposal.
As already stated the deliverables are clearly defined and allotted expected time to accomplish.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal´s goal is to link real business use cases to the cardano blockchain technology. It works on inefficiences of companies through middlemen and is able to cut costs and save time to give companies the opportunity to improve their processes widely. As this project is client driven and wants to work on a real business solution, it perfectly fits into the challenge and is able to show the benefits for other companies as well, as the white paper can be used to create further blue prints. Therefor it can be scaled and is a basis for further develpoments in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The project team made clear milestones and project plans that are shown through easy-to-access process maps. Also details are further explained and there are clear budgets provided (time-wise and money-wise). The budget is clearly broken down into the different project stages and seems realistic in the amounts. The team´s experience fits to the project dedication and all roles are matched with people that seem to have the right experience fort he job. All written CVs seem honest and the reader can see right away that this is not the first project that they work together. All in all it is more than realistic that a productive white paper will be published to succesfully finish the goals of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: As this is a white paper, quantitative KPIs are hard to establish but should be included as well. The team has a programm manager that makes sure that the milestones are met and that the project is qualitivly controlled. To reach an excellent 5-star rating there should be clearer KPIs so the community is able to see the progress of the proposal in just a quick overview. Also the quantitative meazures make an automated progress controlling possible which would make it more efficient. As the proposal tries to cut of middle man, there should be such a solution for the auditing as well.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal team wants to solve the challenge of creating a platform that will make it easier to remove intermediaries from the business process. I agree that if the team can create a feasible way to utilize Cardano capabilities, it may be a game-changing solution for the company and transform the industry as a whole, driving additional companies to join the Carnado ecosystem. For this proposal, a working use-case has already been shown, which is a good indicator of what is needed and will be used. The plan also identifies several major limits and hazards that may arise, as well as some appropriate solutions for each difficulty. Unfortunately, the proposal only gives a generic description of the underlying concept, which is the primary reason for the 4 stars for impact. More information about the mechanism to be used would be beneficial.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members' abilities and experiences are described in great depth. They do not, however, verify them. It would be preferable if they confirmed them on the offered web page or provided links to their LinkedIn summaries, YouTube channels, Twitter accounts, curriculum summary sheets, and so on. For me, the plan for implementing this suggestion is obvious and sufficient. This budget request is for the next three months, and it is split down into five distinct line items, with sufficient information to allow a proper assessment. I am unable to determine whether the requested amounts are suitable because the amount sought fluctuates greatly depending on the local context. However, I understand how they will be distributed, and from that standpoint, the task appears to have been completed.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria are reasonable and important for the next level of funding; nevertheless, the offered measures are tough to assess in my opinion. To minimize misunderstanding among future proposers, I recommend, if feasible, examining the metrics prior to the launch. I agree that the success criteria and associated metrics are appropriate for measuring progress in tackling the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: This was the first recommendation I read about the Realworld business process industry on blockchain. The goal of securities is that it is a bridge between borrowers and lenders, helping businesses have enough working capital. However, market manipulation as well as lack of transparency occurs everywhere. This is a good time for us to study blockchain applications for the stock sector. Blockchain brings security and transparency to the global financial industry, ensuring the main interests of participants. Of course, there are many challenges in practice, mainly in terms of implementation techniques to convert existing Realworld business process to blockchain-applied Realworld business process , as well as the legality of many countries that have not officially recognized blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: A team of many experts, professors, financial industry advisors and technology staff available. I appreciate this factor, which ensures the success of this difficult project. Although the roadmap is not really clear, divided into short timelines, but with the first proposal, and the first phase mainly focuses on building a test of the Realworld business process platform on the blockchain, it is completely feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: Building a Realworld business process trading platform on blockchain is not simple, requires many complex techniques. Therefore, to check it, it is necessary to ask the project to publish the code, regularly report the work progress through the official website or online document. In addition, regularly tracking milestones when the beta and official versions are released, users and businesses should be encouraged to test and comment to improve the efficiency and execution of the work.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea to study about Cardano blockchain ability to remove intermediaries between businesses and consumers is great since it has high application with many businesses in almost every field of business. Having proper research and study about it will minimize the risk of gap between plan and reality when applying for businesses. The project has wise approach that they intend to investigate the gap between business processes needs and technical process because it will help the removal of intermediaries becomes close to the market's need.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is well- written with details explaination about what is their plan and how they will implement it. It shows enthusiasm and commitment of the team. In addition, the team members all have extensive experience related to this field. Information about each member is listed very detailed and impressive. They also explain well about how the Cardano blockchain can facilitate proof of provenance and how they will use a set of real business use cases. The budget breakdown is also on point. The challenges and risks analysis can help them to expect the bad things can happen and be able to minimize it. Plus, a positive point is that their team is Fund 7 proposal winner so they have experience on implement a funded project from Catalyst
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes detailed roadmap which is demonstrated very clever with understandable diagram. Moreover, in each milestone we will receive blockchain developer report from the team and the outcome of study is published which makes it's easy to track the progress and success of the project.

solution: We will use a real business use case as a feasibility study to inform how Cardano blockchain can facilitate the removal of intermediaries.
experience:
Our team has extensive experience of mapping business processes against advanced technologies in very large organisations, and the authoring of resultant review papers.  The outcomes have always been step-changes in functionality and effectiveness.
Fund 7 proposal winner.
